item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/01/05/ids-in-window/#comment-4275">Julien Genestoux (@julien51)</a>.
I don't recommend using <code>window.someid</code> or <code>someid</code> in regular code. From what I've seen ( the link to jsperf in the post ) using <code>document.getElementById( 'someid' );</code> is significantly faster.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Julien Genestoux (@julien51).

I don’t recommend using window.someid or someid in regular code. From what I’ve seen ( the link to jsperf in the post ) using document.getElementById( 'someid' ); is significantly faster.

item.title: By: Julien Genestoux (@julien51)
item.dc:creator: Julien Genestoux (@julien51)
item.description: What is it that you don't recommend? using ids at all or just window.? Because, if you just use ids, they *will* be defined in the window scope, whether you use them or not!
item.content:encoded:
What is it that you don’t recommend? using ids at all or just window.?
Because, if you just use ids, they *will* be defined in the window scope, whether you use them or not!
